<IntroSection>

## What is this?

NumberInputs represent a control for regular numerical input, where you expect the user to modify it by a few incremental steps.

</IntroSection>

<PageSection
  id={tabToc.overview[1].id}
  title={tabToc.overview[1].value}
  explanation="Use the properties value and onChange to handle value changes. Note that the onChange represents a function with the new value as a parameter."
>

```jsx live
function Example() {
  const [value, setValue] = useState('')

  return (
    <NumberInput
      value={value}
      label="Label"
      onChange={(newValue) => setValue(newValue)}
    />
  )
}
```

</PageSection>

<PageSection
  id={tabToc.overview[2].id}
  title={tabToc.overview[2].value}
  explanation="The NumberInputs has two buttons, one to increment the value and the other to decrement it. By default, you can increase or decrease the value one by one, but you can also set a step, so the value will increase or decrease according to it."
>

```jsx live
function Example() {
  return <NumberInput label="Label" step={5} />
}
```

</PageSection>

<PageSection
  id={tabToc.overview[3].id}
  title={tabToc.overview[3].value}
  explanation="It is possible to define limits so that the value is never less than the minimum or greater than the maximum. If you reach one of these limits, the buttons for increasing and decreasing the value will be disabled. The min and max properties should have a value defined to activate this behavior."
>

```jsx live
function Example() {
  return <NumberInput label="Label" min={0} max={4} />
}
```

</PageSection>

<PageSection
  id={tabToc.overview[4].id}
  title={tabToc.overview[4].value}
  explanation="Use the helpText property to indicate the proper way to fill in the numerical input."
>

```jsx live
function Example() {
  return <NumberInput label="Label" helpText="Fill in with a number" />
}
```

</PageSection>

<PageSection
  id={tabToc.overview[5].id}
  title={tabToc.overview[5].value}
  explanation="Use the error property to control and indicate whether it is a valid input or not."
>

```jsx live
function Example() {
  const [value, setValue] = useState('')

  return (
    <NumberInput
      label="Label"
      value={value}
      min={0}
      max={4}
      error={value === ''}
      errorText="Invalid number input"
      onChange={(newValue) => setValue(newValue)}
    />
  )
}
```

</PageSection>

<PageSection
  id={tabToc.overview[6].id}
  title={tabToc.overview[6].value}
  explanation="Disable the NumberInput by setting the disabled property to true.
"
>

```jsx live
function Example() {
  return <NumberInput label="Label" value={2} disabled />
}
```

</PageSection>

</Panel>

>

```jsx
import { NumberInput } from '@vtex/admin-ui'

function Example() {
  const [value, setValue] = useState('')

  return (
    <NumberInput
      value={value}
      label="Label"
      helpText="Help text"
      onChange={(newValue) => setValue(newValue)}
    />
  )
}
```

</PageSection>

## Props

| Name      | Type                                  | Description                              | Required | Default     |
| --------- | ------------------------------------- | ---------------------------------------- | -------- | ----------- |
| label     | `string`                              | Input label                              | ðŸš«       | -           |
| value     | `NumberInputValue (string or number)` | Displayed value                          | ðŸš«       | -           |
| step      | `number`                              | Increment and decrement multiplier value | ðŸš«       | `1`         |
| min       | `number`                              | Min value accepted                       | ðŸš«       | `-Infinity` |
| max       | `number`                              | Max value accepted                       | ðŸš«       | `Infinity`  |
| onChange  | `(value: NumberInputValue) => void`   | Change handler                           | ðŸš«       | -           |
| disabled  | `boolean`                             | Whether its disabled or not              | ðŸš«       | false       |
| error     | `booelan`                             | Tone of voice                            | ðŸš«       | false       |
| errorText | `string`                              | Error message                            | ðŸš«       | -           |
| helpText  | `string`                              | Help text message                        | ðŸš«       | -           |

  </Panel>
  <Panel id="designReference">

## Doâ€™s

1. Always use a default value. If you do not know which one to use, pick 1. This way the user is not forced to type something and then click the buttons.
2. The lean mode is intended to be used on lists, that have a high density of content, and where being able to type the number is not important. It is especially useful in mobile contexts or cramped containers.
3. Do not use for big numbers. Steppers make more sense for small numbers that might be adjusted with a few clicks.
4. Add the units, whenever applicable. Ex. kg, mÂ², days, etc.
